name: Giada Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in May. As other reviewers have stated, the location is perfect. It is a short walk from the hotel to all the major sites in Florence and some excellent restaurants are in the area.
reviews.title: Great location, but loud street noise

reviews.text: Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is small, but it is Europe after all. The staff was nice enough.
reviews.title: Happy Guest

reviews.text: My only problem with this hotel was the street noise. There is a market in the piazza in front of the hotel every day. In the day the noise was tolerable because you probably are not trying to sleep. However, around 4:30 or 5:00 AM the vendors begin to roll their carts out to set up for the day. The sound of them doing this over cobblestones is not quiet! Perhaps if you suggest a room that does not face the front of the hotel you can avoid this.
reviews.title: Do not fall in this hell because of the location

reviews.text: I was very pleased with the accommodation and service I received at this hotel. My room, inlcuding the bathroom were baseic but very clean. They hotel in provided real towels instead of those dish cloths you sometimes get in Italy.
reviews.title: Good location, Bad Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also provided a computer with free internet access and also allowed me to wait in the reception after I had checked out, before I walked to the train station.
reviews.title: Perfect for a short stay

reviews.text: This hotel was booked primarily on the reviews! Thanks to all, we picked this fantastic place. The only thing that worried my family were the comments on the noise from the market. We (my husband,myself and our 2 teenage girls 16 and 17) experienced absolutely NO outside noise day or night!! We stayed in a quad room (#29) which faced the market. It is not pictured on the reviews, however, this room was huge! We had plenty of room! The location is fantastic. We were able to walk from the train station and back with 9...yes...9 pieces of luggage and we managed quite well...with the exception of a few people laughing at us! Trust me....the shopping in Florence is the BEST!!! Just a quick other note...Take bus 12 or 13 to see great sites of Florence without paying the price of a tour....you can get off at any of the tourist places...then just hop back onto one of the same buses to take you back to the main train station! oops...one other thing...across the road from the train station is a tourist info centre...they don't charge for city maps and they will plan out very good map of all the places to see!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We looked and looked for a B&B and finally decided on Giada. The hotel is in a great location. Everything is in short walking distance (even though it looks far on a map - it is truly very very close). Statue of David is 4 blocks away, Duomo is 2 blocks, train station is 2 - 3 blocks, Ponte Vecchio is a 7 minute walk approx (much to see and shop along the way).
reviews.title: Great location and Excellent Staff!

likes.disliked: — Husband says bed, I say there is nothing I disliked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are wonderful! They helped me set up my laptop, which I am not savvy on at all. Oh yes, did I mention the free WI FI and use of their lobby computer.
reviews.title: Good Experience

likes.disliked: — The light in the bathroom burning out

reviews.text: The room is what I expected and the continental breakfast is perfect. Options of croissants, buns, cereal, ham/cheese panini and coffees (cappuccinos, espresso, regular coffee, etc.) They have affordable beverages on hand in the breakfast room. If it rains, which it has on our stay, complimentary umbrellas.
reviews.title: friendly and clean Giada with great sites on your doorstep

reviews.text: The bathroom is what I expect in Europe. It is smaller than what we would get in the States and it does the job. :)
reviews.title: Nice Stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, it is secure and quiet. The double paned windows work great. I know some have mentioned the noise from the market, but I look at it like this, if you don't plan on sleeping in beyond 8:30am - 9:00am, you will be fine. It won't be the noise from the market necessarily waking you, it would be the church bells at this time.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.text: stayed at hotel giada for 3 nights in november. great find in florence. been to flo 6 times this year, each time we try a new hotel. loved the giada. no noise from the market at all. room huge. 4 of us girls shared a 5 bed room. lovley clean bathroom.soft fluffy towels. heated towel rail. beds and bed linen excellent. pillows just right. lovley carpet throughout. cant see what ther is to complain about. stayed in a 4 star near the duomo in sept. not a patch on giada. so the enterence isnt grand, but the rooms make up for it. breakfast good, although we only made one morning. going back to flo in jan and will be staying at the giada. bye the way 6th jan is a lovley day in flo, all sorts happening, its a special day over there, magical. also on the 7th all the shops go in to sale. forgot to say you are very safe in the market area, dont take any notice of people saying its dodgy. were all about 50 and didnt get in until 3 some mornings.
reviews.title: loved the giada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. The light in the bathroom didnt work and when we informed the front desk they did nothing, so we had no light for the whole stay. i would go as far as to say they ruined our trip. They sat us at a dirty table in an almost empty breakfast room and when my boyfriend moved the dirty cups the waiter (if you could call him that) swore at him.... We ended up walking out. We had to stay an extra night because we couldnt get anything else and they tried to charge us 100euros for the night even though i told them we were already staying there- so i got my sister to book it online and we got it for 58 euros. then they said we sould have told them we were staying there These were the most vile people I have ever met.
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL EVER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very very basic, we had read a review on here that said they were surprised it was a 2 star - we were also surprised, i wouldnt even give it 1 star. it was in a great location - but you couldnt pay me to stay there again.
reviews.title: Small ,family run hotel well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel Giada is a little tricky to find simply because it has a small entrance and there is so many hotels in the back streets around the Medici palace. At night the area it is in is a little suspect, but having said that we never encountered any problems on our few days there.
reviews.title: We got what we paid for

reviews.text: However, out front of the hotel is the home to the large Florence market, which means that through the night you can hear the market traders wheeling their stalls down the side streets. You wouldn't think this enough to wake you, but we were forced to move rooms because we couldn't sleep with the racket.
reviews.title: Amazing Location

reviews.text: I stayed for a night....the check in guy and security arrangement a bit strange and even a bit scary but good
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit strage from outsude...but do not be put off as the interior is quite new. The room is very large, much larger than I expected. The bathroom is spacious. The location is also very convenient to all attractions and the train station. seeing the room we were happy and found it worth..it was clean decorated and tidy...
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The entrance is a bit rusty ..The staff was helping and the guy at breakfast table was a bit strange but prompt...
reviews.title: Small but great

reviews.text: ...The hotel is a cosy hotel and at this price... good deal...
reviews.title: Great rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was booked as part of a package deal with an airline from the UK. We flew to Pisa, which is an easy connection to Florence.
reviews.title: Great room and location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Giada for 4 nights in September 2006.
reviews.title: A nice Hotel, but a couple of problems

likes.liked: — The cleanliness of the Hotel and its central location
likes.disliked: — The inconvienence and the noise from the San Lorenzo marketsLook over the top of the market stall

reviews.title: Did not like it at all
reviews.text: A very nice Hotel, very comfortable, with a good bathroom.

However, I would describe the Hotel as "a bit antiseptic". It was "cold and uninviting" not a friendly warm Hotel where the staff became involved with the guests welfare. The staff were not overly friendly and the Hotel sometimes even smelled a bit of antiseptic.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel!
Hotel Giada
reviews.text: The famous San Lorenzo markets are in the same street as the Hotel making the Hotel a bit hard to find. I was really looking forward to seeing the markets and walking through them each time I left the Hotel. However, that was not to be the case. I found the markets to be a real inconvience and a dammed nuisence. They were extremely noisy and had nothing but junk. Most of the traders were north Africans who peddled leather goods and rubbish. There was absolutely nothing Italian about these markets at all. If you are looking for a real Italian market experience, you will be very disappointed..

reviews.title: Very clean and good location
reviews.text: They started early in the morning and did not clear away until about 9-00pm at night. During this time the noise level was extreme and sometimes the noise continued on into the small hours of the morning, with the younger traders playing football and generally making a lot of noise. This did affect sleeping and it is a problem for this Hotel.

description: A small hotel in the heart of Florence, run by the young psychologist Eva with the help of her husband in a creative, dynamic and familiar way. All the rooms equipped with private bathroom, minibar, safe, satellite TV set and telephone. All our guests have free access to internet.
